Title: cadaver heap-based buffer overflow
Synopsis:
There is a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the neon library
    used in cadaver, possibly leading to execution of arbitrary code when
    connected to a malicious server.

Background.Text: cadaver is a command-line WebDAV client.

Description.Text: Stefan Esser discovered a vulnerability in the code of the neon library (see GLSA 200405-13). This library is also included in cadaver.

Impact.Text: When connected to a malicious WebDAV server, this vulnerability could allow remote execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the user running cadaver.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time. All users are advised to upgrade to the latest available version of cadaver.

P.Text: All users of cadaver should upgrade to the latest stable version:
